revised_title: Modeling Concentration Oscillations in CO/Propene Oxidation Over Supported Platinum Catalysts
tldr: This study investigates the oscillatory behavior of carbon monoxide and propene oxidation over a supported platinum catalyst. The authors develop an elementary step model that accounts for the oscillations and demonstrate that it can be applied to this system. The model considers the interactions between gas-phase and surface concentrations, providing a better understanding of the synchronized behavior of metal particles on the catalyst.
